702999f-b.text:
Ashland Place, south from and across DeKalb Avenue.  On the left is a corner of Fort Greene Park and in the background is the Fulton Street elevated structure. The buildings in the center of the photograph are on the south side of DeKalb Avenue, extending to St. Felix Place.
View 2 shows the cone-towered building at the S.E. corner of DeKalb Avenue.

P. L. Sperr           View 1: October 31, 1927
NO REPRODUCTIONS      View 2: July 10, 1932
702999f-b.folder: Ashland Place & DeKalb Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703001f-b.text:
(1)

145 Ashland Place, between De Kalb Ave., and Willoughby Street, showing the City Prison, as seen from Lafayette Street.

July 10, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The Same, from another angle.

July 10, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

703995f-a.text:
125 De Kalb Ave., north side, between Ashland Place aand Fort Greene Park. The view shows St. Phebe's Mission and Convalescent's Rest.
July 10, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
